main.game.animation

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.game.animation.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all methods and variables to create animations. This class only supports animations with frames that all have the same size.
    Version:
    17 sep. 2015
    Author:
    ikhebgeenaccount

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation()
      Default constructor.
      Animation(int frameWidth, int frameHeight)
      Constructor for an animation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addScene(java.awt.Image sceneImage, long sceneLength)
      Add a scene, one frame, to an Animation.
      java.awt.Image getCurrentSceneImage()
      Returns the image corresponding to the scene that currently plays.
      int getFrameHeight()
      Returns the height of a frame in pixels.
      int getFrameWidth()
      Returns the width of a frame in pixels.
      void nextScene()
      This method checks if the next scene should be started.
      void reset()
      Resets an animation to its first frame.
      void start()
      Starts an animation from its first frame.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation()
        Default constructor. This constructor can be called, but it is recommended to use a more specified constructor since this constructor uses default values for all variables.

      • Animation

        public Animation(int frameWidth,
                 int frameHeight)
        Constructor for an animation. Note that all frames have to be the same size.
        Parameters:
        frameWidth - The width of a frame in pixels.
        frameHeight - The height of a frame in pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts an animation from its first frame.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets an animation to its first frame.

      • addScene

        public void addScene(java.awt.Image sceneImage,
                     long sceneLength)
        Add a scene, one frame, to an Animation.
        Parameters:
        sceneImage - The image that the frame consists of
        sceneLength - The length of the scene in milliseconds

      • nextScene

        public void nextScene()
        This method checks if the next scene should be started. If so, does so. Otherwise, it does nothing. When it played the last scene of an animation, it resets the animation.

      • getCurrentSceneImage

        public java.awt.Image getCurrentSceneImage()
        Returns the image corresponding to the scene that currently plays.
        Returns:
        Image currentSceneImage

      • getFrameWidth

        public int getFrameWidth()
        Returns the width of a frame in pixels.
        Returns:
        int frameWidth

      • getFrameHeight

        public int getFrameHeight()
        Returns the height of a frame in pixels.
        Returns:
        int frameHeight
